pull.title: scripted-diff: Replace CCriticalSection with RecursiveMutex
pull.body:
`RecursiveMutex` better clarifies that the mutex is recursive, see also the standard library naming: https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/thread/recursive_mutex

For that reason, and to avoid different people asking me the same question repeatedly (e.g. https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15932#pullrequestreview-339175124 ), remove the outdated alias `CCriticalSection` with a scripted-diff

events.body: Concept ACK: explicit is better than implicit :)

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#17261](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/17261.html) (Make ScriptPubKeyMan an actual interface and the wallet to have multiple by achow101)
* [#16528](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/16528.html) ([WIP] Native Descriptor Wallets (take 2) by achow101)
* [#10443](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/10443.html) (Add fee_est tool for debugging fee estimation code by ryanofsky)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
ACK dc0e8b6b3f665cf764af5c26e3745316ceb95302 -- scripted diff looks correct
Ugh. Messed up my merge order here, should have done this before #17906. @MarcoFalke can you please rebase.

events.message:
scripted-diff: Replace CCriticalSection with RecursiveMutex

-BEGIN VERIFY SCRIPT-
 # Delete outdated alias for RecursiveMutex
 sed -i -e '/CCriticalSection/d'                 ./src/sync.h
 # Replace use of outdated alias with RecursiveMutex
 sed -i -e 's/CCriticalSection/RecursiveMutex/g' $(git grep -l CCriticalSection)
-END VERIFY SCRIPT-

scripted-diff: Bump copyright of files changed in 2020

-BEGIN VERIFY SCRIPT-
./contrib/devtools/copyright_header.py update ./
-END VERIFY SCRIPT-

events.body: Rebased and added another scripted diff to also bump the copyright headers of modified files in one go
ACK e09c701e0110350f78366fb837308c086b6503c0 -- scripted diff looks correct

ACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17891/commits/e09c701e0110350f78366fb837308c086b6503c0 diff and scripts look correct

nit: ideally copyrights commit would be separate because unrelated, but all diffs are comments and it's scripted so nbd.

Speaking of, could the copyright script be run automatically / periodically? I understand not wanting to run it via CI, but I would prefer either automatically/periodically or every time via CI over manually/sporadically.

issue.title: Bitcoin PR tracking
issue.body: The main purpose of this issue is to keep track of Pull Requests on Bitcoin since version 0.19.1 identifying those which make a porting LitecoinZ.

issue.title: Add fee_est tool for debugging fee estimation code
issue.body:
This PR adds an `-estlog` option for saving live fee estimation data from a bitcoin node, and a `fee_est` command line tool for processing the data and testing fee estimation code.

The idea is to make it easier to test improvements to fee estimation like https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10199 in a more systematic and reproducible way.

Some documentation is in [`src/test/fee_est/README.md`](https://github.com/ryanofsky/bitcoin/blob/pr/fee/src/test/fee_est/README.md)

Sample log file: [`est.log.xz`](https://storage.googleapis.com/ryanofsky/est.log.xz) (65M)

Sample [`fee_est.cpp`](https://github.com/ryanofsky/bitcoin/blob/pr/fee/src/test/fee_est/fee_est.cpp)  graph output: 

![graph](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7133040/26331057/f2de8d0c-3f1c-11e7-99ea-de1801d13b05.png)

issue.title: Sugarchain: Introduce YespowerSugar
issue.body:
Reference:
- https://github.com/sugarchain-project/sugarchain/pull/22 by Volbil
- https://github.com/ResistancePlatform/resistance-core/commit/a73d69465c8884e6289ecbdec58331e8fdc0376a by solardiz
- https://github.com/ResistancePlatform/resistance-core/commit/3c80dac3618e42c90057da7ba6fa49c44cf64349
- https://github.com/ResistancePlatform/resistance-core/compare/20c7ba33101133053bd001a84479ff341a134cba...3c80dac3618e42c90057da7ba6fa49c44cf64349

Disabled Tests:
- no fuzz on `00_setup_env_native_fuzz_with_valgrind`
- no unit tests, no functional tests on Arm64
- "--disable-shared" for yespower on Win64
- no extended, no previous releases on x86_64 Linux

Disabled 28 Functional Tests in `test/functional/test_runner.py`
```
- feature_pruning [EXTENDED_SCRIPTS]
- feature_block
- p2p_compactblocks
- p2p_segwit
- p2p_sendheaders
- feature_csv_activation
- feature_bip68_sequence
- interface_zmq
- rpc_blockchain
- p2p_invalid_block
- p2p_invalid_tx
- feature_assumevalid
- example_test
- feature_backwards_compatibility
- feature_versionbits_warning
- p2p_eviction
- feature_nulldummy
- wallet_upgradewallet
- mining_basic
- feature_signet
- wallet_bumpfee
- feature_dersig
- feature_cltv
- wallet_resendwallettransactions
- rpc_dumptxoutset
- feature_minchainwork
- rpc_getblockstats
- wallet_create_tx
- p2p_fingerprint
- p2p_unrequested_blocks
- mempool_compatibility
```

```
- src/primitives/block.cpp

  * SetNullCacheInit() in src/chain.h
```
